name: TPM 2.0 Present
description: A TPM securely stores platform specific secrets that can only be divulged to trusted consumers in a secure environment.
failure-impact: The PCR registers will not be available for use by the bootloader and kernel.
This means userspace cannot either encrypt disks to the specific machine, and also can't know if the system firmware was externally modified.

success-results.found: TPM device found in v2 mode
